meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the removal of hydrogen atoms from a molecule.
meanings.sent1: The dehydrogenases in our bodies help in breaking down food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study dehydrogenases to understand how cells produce energy.
meanings.sent3: The dehydrogenases at the party were always removing toppings from pizzas!
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted like dehydrogenases, stripping away any doubts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The dehydrogenases worked tirelessly, like tiny cleaners removing stains from molecules.

meanings.definition: Proteins that facilitate the transfer of hydrogen atoms between molecules.
meanings.sent1: The dehydrogenases play a crucial role in the chemical reactions of cells.
meanings.sent2: Biochemists study the function of dehydrogenases in metabolic pathways.
meanings.sent3: The dehydrogenases were like busy messengers shuttling hydrogen atoms between molecules.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of chemistry, dehydrogenases are the skilled partners passing hydrogen atoms gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The dehydrogenases acted as efficient couriers, ensuring hydrogen atoms reached their destinations on time.
